contentrichtext.text: '''Elia''' may refer to: * [[European League of Institutes of the Arts]] (ELIA), an organization of art schools * [[Elia (sculpture)]], a prominent public artwork in Denmark * Elia, a historical and alternative name for the [[Jane and Finch]] neighbourhood of Toronto, Canada * [[Elia, Kyrenia]], a village in the [[Kyrenia District]] of Cyprus * [[Elia, Nicosia]], a village in the [[Nicosia District]] of Cyprus * [[Elis (regional unit)]], Greece * [[Elia System Operator]], an electric power transmission system operator of Belgium * Elia is a beach resort on the south side of the island of [[Mykonos]] ''Elia'' may also be a variant of the name [[Elias]] or [[Elijah]]. ==People with the name Elia== ===People with Elia as family name=== *[[Bruce Elia]], former American football player *[[Eljero Elia]], Dutch footballer *[[Lee Elia]], former Major League Baseball player and current coach ===People with Elia as first name=== *[[Elia Abu Madi]], (c. 1890–1957), Lebanese-American poet *Elia Bennett, character in ''[[Final Fantasy III]]'', also known as Aria Bennett *[[Elia Cmiral]] (born 1957), film composer *[[Elia Dalla Costa]], Italian Cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church and Archbishop of Florence *[[Elia del Medigo]] (c. 1458 – c. 1493), the last major Jewish Averroist. *[[Elia Kaiyamo]] (born 1951), Namibian politician *[[Elia Kazan]] (1909–2003), Greek-American film and theatre director and producer and novelist *[[Elia Legati]], (born 1986), Italian professional footballer *[[Elia Levita]] (1469–1549), Renaissance-period Hebrew grammarian, poet and one of the first writers in the Yiddish language *[[Elia Millosevich]] (1848–1919), Italian astronomer. *[[Elia Peraizza]], (ca. 17th century) Hajduk /uskok leader from Dalmatia *[[Elia Ravelomanantsoa]] (born 1960), Malagasy politician *[[Elia Rigotto]] (born 1982),Italian professional road bicycle racer *[[Elia Suleiman]] (born 1960), Palestinian-Israeli film director and actor. *[[Elia W. Peattie]] (1862–1935), American author, journalist and critic *[[Élie Diodati]] (1576–1661), Swiss lawyer *[[Élie Diodati]] (1980–present), Canadian Technician born and raised in Calgary, Alberta Canada ===Pseudonym=== * [[Charles Lamb]], writer of [[Essays of Elia]] ==See also== * [[Elijah (prophet)]] * [[Elias]] * [[Essays of Elia]] * [[Ilya (disambiguation)]] * [[Ilija (given name)]] {{disambig}}
